snippet: Entourages have been expanding for years in professional tennis, but the latest expansion, particularly among the elite, is coming in the coaching ranks.
abstract: Christopher Clary On Tennis column notes that coaching ranks are expanding for sport's elite players, as evidenced at the French Open; holds that, for now, the multiple-coach trend is being pushed along in part by herd mentality, in part by players looking for any edge and in part by the realization that former stars are rarely interested in traveling the circuit full time but are willing to do it part time.
lead_paragraph: Entourages have been expanding for years in professional tennis, but the latest expansion, particularly among the elite, is coming in the coaching ranks.

headline.main: You Can’t Tell the Tennis Stars’ Coaches Without a Scorecard
headline.print_headline: You Need a Scorecard to Tally the Coaches
